climbs.name: Who Needs GF when You Have GP?

content.description: Sit start at Yes/No checkbox. Move up through bright blue graffiti. Reach a lip and work slopers up short slab to top. Convenient tree for down climb.
content.location: Other side of the trees from Blue Lines, right of Drop Party.

content.description: The middle route on the Tagged Slab. Crux in the middle - use small crimps and some fancy footwork to top it out.
content.protection: Pads - the ground is pretty sloped, so the bigger the better.
content.location: (Follow instructions for Drug Rugs and Chemtrails.)

content.description: Follow the right arete to the top, just do it.
Follow the left arete to the top. A little steeper than the right side, but you can still do it!
Follow the flakes next to the arete without using it to the top.  Great route to warm up on, easy the whole way up.
content.protection: Pads - the ground is pretty sloped, so the bigger the better.
content.location: Rightmost route on the Tagged Slab face.

content.description: The crux is fairly mental, being the most highball route on the slab.   A few small pockets and meager footholds make this route quite balancey and fun.
content.protection: Pads - the ground is pretty sloped, so the bigger the better.
content.location: Leftmost route on the Tagged Slab face.

content.description: Sit start below the big bread loaf (pictured) and move up through slopers and pockets. Short slab tops out just next to the juniper.
content.location: Located uphill and across the trail from bitch slab on other graffiti rock, left of Blue Lines. Look for the loaf!

content.description: Ok route consisting of plentiful pockets and colorful crimps.  Crux at the top with not much to grab.   Trees are off, unless you want to use them.
content.location: From the Tagged Slab, look left for the other grafittied wall - climbs right of the tree.

content.description: A cool slabby boulder that has probably been scrambled by students and defaced by delinquents for many years. Â Although a bit short, the technical and balancy movement combined with a sloped landing add up to somewhat heady climbing - bring a few pads.
